00027 
00028 #include "translation/GeneCall.h"

00043 /*****************************************************************************/
00044 /**
00045  * GeneCall::GeneCall
00046  * Synopsis:
00047  *
00048  * Translation Table constructer. The translation table row order is
00049  * per marker. The column order starting with Reference, Variant
00050  * and then A1 - ANN is what is being defined here as a call.
00051  * The translation table is rows of markes with columns of calls.
00052  *
00053  * Each gene has a number of calls designated. The GeneCall object
00054  * represents the entire set of calls for a gene. The GeneCall is
00055  * a set of sets, where the sets are CallSets. The CallSets are sets
00056  * of CallElements where the CallElements represent the probset id
00057  * with reference and variant alleles.
00058  *
00059  * A GeneCall then represents the set of columns A1 - A50 (ANN) of the
00060  * translation table for a particular gene.
00061  *
00062  * The columns are chopped up at the Gene level. Within
00063  * a gene, the column is subdivided by haplotype or marker.
00064  * A column, like A1, then will have one GeneCall per marker where
00065  * the "Haplotype" column is "N". For those markers of the gene
00066  * where "Haplotype" column is "Y" then exactly one GeneCall is created.
00067  *
00068  * NOTE: While in general the "Haplotype" column is "Y" records are grouped
00069  * together for a particular gene in the translation table, this is not
00070  * always the case. Probe sets with "Haplotype" column of "Y" can be
00071  * interpersed with the "Haplotype" column "N" probesets.
00072  *
00073  * For a particular gene there is ever only one haplotype group.
00074  * That group is designated by the set of markers for the gene with
00075  * "Haplotype" column indicator of "Y".
00076  * A gene haplotype call (GeneCall) then corresponds to a column for
00077  * all those rows of a gene in the translation table within a haplotype group.
00078  *
00079  * This constructor takes in the header row for a particular gene
00080  * and then instantiates all the CallSets for all the columns.
00081  *
00082  * The CallSets for each call is subsequently filled with the probe set ids,
00083  * reference and variant alleles when the translation table is scanned.
00084  *
00085  * In other words, multiple data structures are being created when the
00086  * translation table is being scanned. To prevent scanning the table
00087  * multiple times this constructor simply instantiates the empty CallSet
00088  * per call and the callee (TranslationTable) is responsible for filling
00089  * in the CallSets per call as the subsequent rows are being scanned.
00090  *
00091  *
00092  * @param rte - RunTimeEnvironment which contains options
00093  * @param ttm - TranslationTableModel with the meta data about the call.
00094  * @param headerRow - the row in the ttm that has the meta data.
00095  * @param isHaplotypeCall - if the data row has been predetermined to
00096  *   have "Y" in the "Haplotype" column.
00097  *
00098  */
00099 /*****************************************************************************/
00100 GeneCall::GeneCall(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00101                    TranslationTableModel & ttm,
00102                    const int headerRow,
00103                    bool isHaplotypeCall)
00104 
00105 {
00106 
00107   APT_ERR_ASSERT((headerRow >= 0) && (headerRow < ttm.size()), "");
00108 
00109   m_gene = ttm.m_rows[headerRow][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_GENE)];
00110 
00111   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, "GeneCall::GeneCall initializing gene: " + m_gene);
00112 
00113   // Initialize the m_alleleSet for each possible call.
00114 
00115   std::stringstream alleleNamesSStr;
00116 
00117   pcrecpp::RE reCommentedOut("^\\s*#");
00118   // Skip commented out column names.
00119   std::map<int, int> columnToAlleleIndex;
00120   std::map<std::string, int> numHaplotypeMarkers;
00121 
00122 
00123   for (int i = ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_REFERENCE); i < ttm.columnCount(); i++) {
00124 
00125 
00126     // For markers, only add the allele if the header is copy number 0.
00127     // We can only tell if the header is copy number zero if the data
00128     // in the following row equals "0";
00129     if (!isHaplotypeCall && (i >= ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_ALLELE_START)) && (((headerRow + 1) >= ttm.size()) || (ttm.m_rows[headerRow +1][i] != "0"))) {
00130       continue;
00131     }
00132 
00133     std::string alleleName = ttm.getHeaderRowColumnName(headerRow, i);
00134 
00135     if (existsAlleleCallSet(alleleName)) {
00136       // Copy Number 0 applies to all markers, ignore it.
00137       if (((headerRow + 1) < ttm.size()) && (ttm.m_rows[headerRow +1][i] == "0")) {
00138         continue;
00139       }
00140 
00141       Verbose::warn(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, "Duplicate allele name found: " + alleleName + " for translation file row: " + ttm.getRowAsString(headerRow));
00142     }
00143 
00144     // All allele name columns will have a name until we get to the last one.
00145     if (!alleleName.empty() && !reCommentedOut.PartialMatch(alleleName)) {
00146       columnToAlleleIndex[i] = m_alleleSet.size();
00147       m_alleleSet.push_back(CallSet(alleleName, i));
00148       alleleNamesSStr << alleleName << " ";
00149       numHaplotypeMarkers[alleleName] = 0;
00150     }
00151   }
00152 
00153   if (isHaplotypeCall) {
00154     for (int i = headerRow; (i < ttm.size()) && (ttm.m_rows[i][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_GENE)] == m_gene); i++) {
00155       for (int j = ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_REFERENCE);
00156            j < ttm.columnCount(); j++) {
00157 
00158         if (!ttm.m_rows[i][j].empty() &&
00159             (ttm.m_rows[i][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_HAPLOTYPE)] == "Y")) {
00160           numHaplotypeMarkers[m_alleleSet[columnToAlleleIndex[j]].m_name]++;
00161         }
00162       }
00163     }
00164     // If an Allele doesn't belong to a haplotype group, then just remove it.
00165     for (int i = m_alleleSet.size() - 1; i >= 0 ; i--) {
00166       if ((m_alleleSet[i].m_columnInTranslationTable >
00167            ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_ALLELE_START)) &&
00168           (numHaplotypeMarkers[m_alleleSet[i].m_name] == 0)) {
00169         m_alleleSet.erase(m_alleleSet.begin() + i);
00170       }
00171     }
00172   }
00173 
00174   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, "GeneCall::GeneCall gene: " + m_gene + ": initializing allele names: " + alleleNamesSStr.str());
00175   //describeVerbose(rte, ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL );
00176 
00177   return;
00178 
00179 }
00180 // end GeneCall::GeneCall
00181 /*****************************************************************************/
00182 /*****************************************************************************/
00183 /**
00184  * GeneCall::addCallElementToAlleleCallSet
00185  * Synopsis:
00186  *
00187  * Initialize a CallElement from the translation table (and not
00188  * an experiment data in the Genotype data (CHP)).
00189  * To do this we need to identify the ProbeSet and
00190  * the reference and variant base. The variant base will be either in the
00191  * column that resides between A1-A29 or in the "Variant" column itself
00192  * if no such animal exists.
00193  *
00194  *
00195  * @param ttm - TranslationTableModel with the meta data about the call.
00196  * @param headerRow - the row in the ttm that has the meta data.
00197  * @param row - the row in the TranslationTableModel in question.
00198  * @param column - the column in the TranslationTableModel in question.
00199  * @param allowMultiAllelic - probeSet may appear multiple times.
00200  * @param rowIsHaplotype - "Haplotype" column has "Y"
00201  *
00202  * @return - true upon successfull add.
00203  */
00204 /*****************************************************************************/
00205 bool GeneCall::addCallElementToAlleleCallSet(TranslationTableModel & ttm,
00206     const int headerRow,
00207     const int row,
00208     const int column,
00209     const bool allowMultiAllelic,
00210     const bool rowIsHaplotype)
00211 
00212 {
00213 
00214   APT_ERR_ASSERT((headerRow >= 0) && (headerRow < ttm.size()) &&
00215                  (row >= 0) && (row < ttm.size()) &&
00216                  (headerRow < row), "");
00217   APT_ERR_ASSERT((column >= ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_REFERENCE)) &&
00218                  (column < ttm.columnCount()), "");
00219 
00220 
00221   std::string alleleName = ttm.getHeaderRowColumnName(headerRow, column);
00222 
00223   std::vector< class CallSet >::iterator itCS;
00224 
00225   for (itCS = m_alleleSet.begin();
00226        itCS != m_alleleSet.end() ; ++itCS) {
00227 
00228     if (itCS->m_name == alleleName) {
00229       itCS->m_type = rowIsHaplotype ? ADT_CALL_TYPE_HAPLOTYPE_GROUP :
00230                      ADT_CALL_TYPE_MARKER;
00231       itCS->m_isDescriptive = true;
00232       return itCS->addCallElement(ttm, row, column, allowMultiAllelic, rowIsHaplotype);
00233     }
00234   }
00235 
00236   std::stringstream msgSStr;
00237 
00238   msgSStr << "addCallElementToAlleleCallSet: can't find allele name: " <<  alleleName <<  " from the following possibilities: ";
00239   for (itCS = m_alleleSet.begin();
00240        itCS != m_alleleSet.end() ; ++itCS) {
00241     msgSStr << itCS->m_name << " ";
00242   }
00243 
00244   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, msgSStr.str());
00245 
00246   for (itCS = m_alleleSet.begin();
00247        itCS != m_alleleSet.end() ; ++itCS) {
00248     //itCS->describeVerbose(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL );
00249   }
00250 
00251   return false;
00252 
00253 }
00254 // end GeneCall::addCallElementToAlleleCallSet

00257 /**
00258  * _getNumDescriptive
00259  * Synopsis:
00260  *
00261  * Helper function for describeVerbose only.
00262  * Return the number of CallSets in the m_alleleSet which are descriptive.
00263  *
00264  *
00265  * @return int - the number of descriptive
00266  */
00267 /*****************************************************************************/
00268 static int _getNumDescriptive(const std::vector<CallSet> & alleleSet)
00269 {
00270 
00271   int i = 0;
00272   int numDescriptive = 0;
00273 
00274   for (i = 0, numDescriptive = 0 ; i < alleleSet.size(); i++) {
00275     if (alleleSet[i].m_isDescriptive)
00276       numDescriptive++;
00277   }
00278 
00279   return numDescriptive;
00280 
00281 }
00282 // end _getNumDescriptive
00283 /*****************************************************************************/
00284 /*****************************************************************************/
00285 /**
00286  * _getNumNonDescriptive
00287  * Synopsis:
00288  *
00289  * Helper function for describeVerbose only.
00290  * Return the number of CallSets in the m_alleleSet which are not descriptive.
00291  *
00292  *
00293  * @return int - the number of non descriptive
00294  *
00295  */
00296 /*****************************************************************************/
00297 static int _getNumNonDescriptive(const std::vector<CallSet> & alleleSet)
00298 {
00299   return (alleleSet.size() - _getNumDescriptive(alleleSet));
00300 }
00301 // end _getNumNonDescriptive
00302 /*****************************************************************************/

00304 /**
00305  * GeneCall::describeVerbose
00306  * Synopsis:
00307  *
00308  * Run time debug routine that can be invoked with various verbose levels.
00309  * ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES is the default level.
00310  *
00311  * @param rte       - run time environment
00312  * @param level     - ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES by default,
00313  *                    otherwise the ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM level to output
00314  *
00315  */
00316 /*****************************************************************************/
00317 void GeneCall::describeVerbose(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM level)
00318 {
00319 
00320   if (!level && (rte.m_currentVerbosity < ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES))
00321     return;
00322 
00323   ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM outLevel = level ? level : ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES;
00324 
00325   std::stringstream describe1SStr;
00326 
00327   describe1SStr << "GeneCall::describeVerbose gene: " << m_gene << ":";
00328   describe1SStr << " alleleSet total count : ";
00329   describe1SStr << m_alleleSet.size() << endl;
00330   describe1SStr << "GeneCall::describeVerbose gene: " << m_gene << ":";
00331   describe1SStr << " alleleSet descriptive count : ";
00332   describe1SStr << _getNumDescriptive(m_alleleSet) << endl;
00333   describe1SStr << "GeneCall::describeVerbose gene: " << m_gene << ":";
00334   describe1SStr << " alleleSet non-descriptive count : ";
00335   describe1SStr << _getNumNonDescriptive(m_alleleSet);
00336   Verbose::out(outLevel, describe1SStr.str());
00337 
00338   std::stringstream describe4SStr;
00339   describe4SStr << "GeneCall::describeVerbose gene: " << m_gene << ": ";
00340   describe4SStr << "vector<CallSet> alleleSet follows: " ;
00341 
00342   Verbose::out(outLevel, describe4SStr.str());
00343 
00344   int i;
00345   for (i = 0; i < m_alleleSet.size(); i++) {
00346     m_alleleSet[i].describeVerbose(rte, level);
00347   }
00348 
00349   return;
00350 
00351 }
00352 // end GeneCall::describeVerbose
00353 /*****************************************************************************/

00355 /**
00356  * GeneCall::existsAlleleCallSet
00357  * Synopsis:
00358  *
00359  * Returns true if a CallSet in m_alleleSet has the passed in allele name.
00360  *
00361  * @params alleleName - the call name to check (i.e. "Ref", "*4")
00362  *
00363  */
00364 /*****************************************************************************/
00365 bool GeneCall::existsAlleleCallSet(const std::string & alleleName)
00366 {
00367 
00368   std::vector<CallSet>::iterator itCS;
00369 
00370   for (itCS = m_alleleSet.begin(); itCS != m_alleleSet.end(); itCS++) {
00371     if (itCS->m_name == alleleName) {
00372       return true;
00373     }
00374   }
00375 
00376   return false;
00377 }
00378 // end GeneCall::existsAlleleCallSet
00379 /*****************************************************************************/
00380 /**
00381  * GeneCall::getAlleleCallSet
00382  * Synopsis:
00383  *
00384  * Convienance function to return either the Reference or Variant allele set.
00385  *
00386  * @param index - between 0 and  num m_alleleSet.size()
00387  *
00388  * @return CallSet reference corresponding to the index.
00389  */
00390 /*****************************************************************************/
00391 CallSet &  GeneCall::getAlleleCallSet(unsigned int index)
00392 {
00393 
00394   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_alleleSet.size() > 0, "");
00395 
00396   return m_alleleSet[index];
00397 
00398 }
00399 // end GeneCall::getAlleleCallSet
00400 /*****************************************************************************/

00402 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00403 //                      TRANSLATION ALGORITHM                               //
00404 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

00406 /*****************************************************************************/
00407 /**
00408  * _getProbeSetBaseCount
00409  * Synopsis:
00410  *
00411  * Helper function to be called only once by _calculateTHPR, broken out
00412  * for clarity.
00413  *
00414  * Any ProbeSet Id in the translation table will have two possible bases
00415  * for the first row, and one additional for every row thereafter.
00416  * This is represented in the completeSet passed in as one CallElement
00417  * per ProbeSet Id and a list of bases associated therein.
00418  *
00419  *
00420  *
00421  * @params chromatid1 - CallSet generated from ALLELE1 column from Genotype data.
00422  * @params completeSet - CallSet generated from the translation table
00423  *                       with possible multi-allelic bases.
00424  * @params ch1Index - CallElement index to compare. Note that CallElements
00425  *                   are keyed by ProbeSet. The i'th element refers to the
00426  *                   i'th element in chromatid1 and the same probe set in
00427  *                   completeSet that corresponds to the i'th element in
00428  *                   chromatid1.
00429  *
00430  * @returns count - the number of bases in completeSet.
00431  */
00432 /*****************************************************************************/
00433 static int _getProbeSetBaseCount(const CallSet & chromatid1,
00434                                  const CallSet & completeSet,
00435                                  const int ch1Index)
00436 {
00437 
00438   APT_ERR_ASSERT(ch1Index < chromatid1.size(), "");
00439 
00440   std::map< std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator iCEit
00441   = chromatid1.m_ceSet.begin();
00442 
00443   for (int i = 0; i < ch1Index; i++, iCEit++) {};
00444 
00445   const CallElement & ceCompleteSet
00446   = completeSet.getProbeSetCallElement(iCEit->second.m_probeSet);
00447 
00448   APT_ERR_ASSERT(ceCompleteSet.getCompleteSetSize() > 1, "");
00449 
00450   return (ceCompleteSet.getCompleteSetSize());
00451 
00452 }
00453 // end GeneCall::_getProbeSetBaseCount
00454 /*****************************************************************************/
00455 /*****************************************************************************/
00456 /**
00457  * _isHeteroZygousPair
00458  * Synopsis:
00459  *
00460  * Helper function to be called only once by _calculateTHPR, broken out
00461  * for clarity.
00462  *
00463  * If the CallElements between the two CallSets for the i'th element have
00464  * the same base then they are consider homozygous, else heterozygous.
00465  *
00466  *
00467  * @params chromatid1 - CallSet generated from ALLELE1 column from Genotype data.
00468  * @params chromatid2 - CallSet generated from ALLELE2 column from Genotype data.
00469  * @params ch1Index - CallElement index to compare. Note that CallElements
00470  *                   are keyed by ProbeSet. The i'th element refers to the
00471  *                   i'th element in chromatid1 and the same probe set in
00472  *                   chromatid2 that corresponds to the i'th element in
00473  *                   chromatid1.
00474  *
00475  * @returns true - if the bases for the CallElements compared are different.
00476  */
00477 /*****************************************************************************/
00478 static bool _isHeteroZygousPair(const CallSet & chromatid1,
00479                                 const CallSet & chromatid2,
00480                                 const int ch1Index)
00481 
00482 {
00483   APT_ERR_ASSERT(ch1Index < chromatid1.size(), "");
00484   std::map< std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator iCEit =
00485     chromatid1.m_ceSet.begin();
00486 
00487   for (int i = 0; i < ch1Index; i++, iCEit++) {}
00488 
00489   const CallElement & ceChromatid1 = chromatid1.getProbeSetCallElement(iCEit->second.m_probeSet);
00490   const CallElement & ceChromatid2 = chromatid2.getProbeSetCallElement(iCEit->second.m_probeSet);
00491 
00492   // Ok, even though there can be multiple bases in a CallElement, that
00493   // only applies to CallElements constructed from the Translation Table.
00494   // For CallElements constructed from the Genotype data there is always
00495   // ever exactly one base.
00496 
00497   std::string base1 = ceChromatid1.m_bases[0];
00498   std::string base2 = ceChromatid2.m_bases[0];
00499 
00500   APT_ERR_ASSERT(!base1.empty() && !base2.empty(), "");
00501 
00502 
00503   return (base1 != base2);
00504 }
00505 // end GeneCall::_isHeteroZygousPair
00506 /*****************************************************************************/
00507 /*****************************************************************************/
00508 /**
00509  * _calculateTHPR
00510  * Synopsis:
00511  *
00512  * Helper function to be called only once by GeneCall::translateExperimentCall,
00513  * broken out for clarity.
00514  *
00515  * Calculate the requred number of haplotype matches given tri-allelic and
00516  * wild-cards are in the mix. Note that MARKERs are considered HAPLOTYPE GROUP
00517  * of size 1 for the purposes of this API.
00518  *
00519  *
00520  * Key:
00521  *
00522  * 0 : false, no heterozygous base pairs have been detected.
00523  * 1 : true, at least one heterozygous base pair has been detected.
00524  *
00525  * THP0 : Total Haplotype Marker Pairs, no heterozygous base pairs have been detected.
00526  * THP1 : Total Haplotype Marker Pairs, at least one heterozygous base pair has been detected.
00527  * i : iteration count of the number of haplotype marker pairs analyzed so far.
00528  * Ni : for a Wildcard, iteration translation table possible allele bases
00529  *      corresponding to the
00530  *      probe set Haplotype marker pairs with the wildcard.
00531  *      For bi-allelic this is two bases,
00532  *      the reference and the variant. For tri-allelic this number is 3, for
00533  *      the reference and two variants.
00534  *
00535  *  * : wildcard pair of Haplotype Markers.
00536  *
00537  * Formuala:
00538  *
00539  *
00540  * THP0(0) = 1
00541  * THP1(0) = 0
00542  *
00543  *             { i+1: homozygous   => THP0(i)
00544  * THP0(i+1) = | i+1: heterozygous => 0
00545  *             { i+1: *            => THP0(i) * Ni
00546  *
00547  *             { i+1: homozygous   => THP1(i)
00548  * THP1(i+1) = | i+1: heterozygous => 2*THP1(i) + THP0(i)
00549  *             { i+1: *            => Ni * THP1(i) + ( Ni(Ni-1)/2 ) *
00550  *                                    2*THP1(i) + ( Ni(Ni - 1) )/2) * THP0(i)
00551  *
00552  * THPR = THP1(total) + THP0(total)
00553  *
00554  * @param chromatid1 - ALLELE1 column in the genotype file.
00555  * @param chromatid2 - ALLELE2 column in the genotype file.
00556  * @param completeSet - from the translation table, the complete set
00557  *                       of possible probe sets, possible multi-allelic.
00558  * @param HPPA      - passed in for return.
00559  *
00560  * @return HPPA - the number of haplotype pairs possible per allele.
00561  * @return THPR - the total number of required haplotype paris.
00562  *                 If this total is not found then UNK should be used
00563  *                 to generate the required total.
00564  */
00565 /*****************************************************************************/
00566 static int _calculateTHPR(const CallSet & chromatid1,
00567                           const CallSet & chromatid2,
00568                           const CallSet & completeSet,
00569                           int & HPPA)
00570 {
00571 
00572 
00573 
00574   // NON-HAPLOTYPE GROUP MARKERS and HAPLOTYPE GROUPS of size 1.
00575   if (chromatid1.m_copyNumber == 0) {
00576     return 1;
00577   }
00578 
00579   // HAPLOTYPE GROUP MARKERS
00580   int THPR = 0;
00581 
00582   int THP0 = 1;
00583   int THP1 = 0;
00584 
00585   HPPA = 1;
00586   std::map< std::string, CallElement>::const_iterator iCEit = chromatid1.m_ceSet.begin();
00587 
00588   for (int i = 0; i < chromatid1.size(); i++, iCEit++) {
00589 
00590     bool isHet = _isHeteroZygousPair(chromatid1, chromatid2, i);
00591     int  Ni    = _getProbeSetBaseCount(chromatid1, completeSet, i);
00592 
00593 
00594     if (iCEit->second.hasWildCards()) {
00595       // HPPA
00596       HPPA *= Ni;
00597       // THP1
00598       THP1 = Ni * THP1 + (Ni) * (Ni - 1) * THP1 + ((Ni) * (Ni - 1) / 2) * THP0;
00599       // THP0
00600       THP0 = THP0 * Ni;
00601     } else if (isHet) {
00602       // THP1
00603       THP1 = 2 * THP1 + THP0;
00604       // THP0
00605       THP0 = 0;
00606     } else { // is homozygous
00607       // THP1 = THP1;
00608       // THP0 = THP0;
00609     }
00610 
00611   }
00612 
00613   THPR = THP0 + THP1;
00614 
00615   return THPR;
00616 
00617 }
00618 // end GeneCall::_calculateTHPR
00619 /*****************************************************************************/
00620 /*****************************************************************************/
00621 /**
00622  * _translateExperimentCallCheck
00623  * Synopsis:
00624  *
00625  * Helper function to be called only once by GeneCall::translateExperimentCall,
00626  * broken out for clarity.
00627  *
00628  * Does all the upfront validation and exception throwing.
00629  * Note the multiple catches. This means all exceptions will be logged
00630  * if multiple exist and not just the first exception.
00631  *
00632  * @param rte - RunTimeEnvironment which contains options
00633  * @param completeSet - the known universe of accepted probeSets/bases.
00634  * @param chromatid1 - ALLELE1 from the Genotype Short Report.
00635  * @param chromatid2 - ALLELE2 from the Genotype Short Report.
00636  * @param alleleSet  - the CallSets of calls.
00637  *
00638  *
00639  * @returns true - if no exceptions were logged and its ok to continue
00640  *                 call translation.
00641  */
00642 /*****************************************************************************/
00643 static bool _translateExperimentCallCheck(RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00644     const CallSet & completeSet,
00645     const std::string & geneName,
00646     const std::string & experimentName,
00647     CallSet & chromatid1,
00648     CallSet & chromatid2,
00649     const std::vector<CallSet> & alleleSet)
00650 {
00651 
00652   bool okToCall = true;
00653 
00654   std::vector<class CallSet>::const_iterator testCallSetIt = alleleSet.begin();
00655 
00656   // All experiments should have a minimum of 1 CallSet, the reference set.
00657   APT_ERR_ASSERT(testCallSetIt != alleleSet.end(), "");
00658 
00659   if (!completeSet.contains(chromatid1)) {
00660     std::stringstream msgSStr;
00661     completeSet.describeVerbose(rte, ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL);
00662     chromatid1.describeVerbose(rte, ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL);
00663     msgSStr << experimentName << " " << geneName << " " << chromatid1.m_name <<  ": invalid probe set / base detected.";
00664     if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_ignoreUnknownAlleles) {
00665       okToCall = false;
00666     } else {
00667       APT_ERR_ABORT(msgSStr.str());
00668     }
00669 
00670   }
00671 
00672   if (!completeSet.contains(chromatid2)) {
00673     std::stringstream msgSStr;
00674     msgSStr << experimentName << " " << geneName << " " << chromatid2.m_name <<  ": invalid probe set / base detected.";
00675     if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_ignoreUnknownAlleles) {
00676       okToCall = false;
00677     } else {
00678       APT_ERR_ABORT(msgSStr.str());
00679     }
00680   }
00681 
00682   std::stringstream completeSStr;
00683   completeSStr <<  experimentName << ", " <<  geneName <<  ", " << testCallSetIt->m_name << ": incomplete probe set for haplotype group detected.";
00684 
00685   if (chromatid1.size() != testCallSetIt->size()) {
00686 
00687     if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_enforceCompleteHaplotypeGroup) {
00688       APT_ERR_ABORT(completeSStr.str());
00689     }
00690     Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_EXCEPTION, completeSStr.str());
00691     okToCall = false;
00692   }
00693 
00694   if (chromatid2.m_ceSet.size() != testCallSetIt->m_ceSet.size()) {
00695 
00696     if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_enforceCompleteHaplotypeGroup) {
00697       APT_ERR_ABORT(completeSStr.str());
00698     }
00699     okToCall = false;
00700     Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_EXCEPTION, completeSStr.str());
00701   }
00702 
00703   // Ok, this is a HAPLOTYPE GROUP or MARKER and all items are NC
00704   // then just return an empty call.
00705   if (chromatid1.hasWildCards() &&
00706       (chromatid1.numWildCards() == chromatid1.size())) {
00707 
00708     okToCall = false;
00709   }
00710 
00711   return okToCall;
00712 }
00713 // end _translateExperimentCallCheck
00714 /*****************************************************************************/
00715 /*****************************************************************************/
00716 /**
00717  * _translateExperimentCallCopyNumberOne
00718  * Synopsis:
00719  *
00720  *  Helper function for translateExperimentCall broken out for brevity.
00721  *  Specifically translates to a copy number 1 call result.
00722  *
00723  * @param rte         - single instance of the run time environment
00724  * @param results     - for return
00725  * @param chromatid1  - from the experiment data for the single chromatid
00726  * @param geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet - for the specific gene
00727  *
00728  * @return results - updated with copy number "data" for pairing with
00729  * the chromatid1 passed in.
00730  */
00731 /*****************************************************************************/
00732 static void _translateExperimentCallCopyNumberOne(
00733   const RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00734   CallResults & results,
00735   const CallSet & chromatid1,
00736   const CallSet & geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet)
00737 {
00738 
00739   // COPY NUMBER 1
00740   if (chromatid1.m_copyNumber != 1) {
00741     return;
00742   }
00743   std::string copy1Name;
00744 
00745   if (geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet.getCallType() != ADT_CALL_TYPE_NULL) {
00746     copy1Name = geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet.m_name;
00747   } else {
00748     APT_ERR_ABORT(results.m_experimentName + " " + results.m_geneName + ": copy number 1 values detected with no copy number 0 designation in the translation file.");
00749   }
00750 
00751   if (results.size() == 0) {
00752     results.appendAlleleCall(copy1Name , 1, geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet);
00753     return;
00754   }
00755 
00756   std::map< std::string, bool> callCount;
00757   std::vector<CallResults::AlleleCall> newResults;
00758 
00759 
00760   for (int i = results.m_alleleCalls.size() - 1; i >= 0 ; i--) {
00761 
00762     std::string alleleCall = copy1Name +  "/" +  results.m_alleleCalls[i].m_allele;
00763     //cerr << experimentName << " " <<  geneName << " : copy number 0 call"  << alleleCall << endl;
00764     alleleCall = alleleCall.substr(0, alleleCall.rfind('/'));
00765 
00766     if (callCount[alleleCall]) {
00767       results.m_alleleCalls.erase(results.m_alleleCalls.begin() + 1);
00768       results.m_markerCallCount--;
00769     } else {
00770       callCount[alleleCall] = true;
00771       results.m_alleleCalls[i].m_allele = alleleCall;
00772     }
00773   }
00774 
00775   return;
00776 
00777 }
00778 // end _translateExperimentCallCopyNumberOne
00779 /*****************************************************************************/
00780 /*****************************************************************************/
00781 /**
00782  * Translating an experiment call means checking for allele names that
00783  * correspond in the DMET3 translation table. For reporting purposes all
00784  * input experiment records from the Genotype CHIP or Short Report files
00785  * are to have a corresponding record somewhere in the reporting, i.e.
00786  * be included in the result set. There only exception are for unrecognized
00787  * genes. An unrecognized gene is simply skipped over. Records for unrecognized
00788  * genes will not be in the experiment results.
00789  *
00790  *
00791  * @param rte - RunTimeEnvironment which contains options
00792  * @param ttm - TranslationTableModel with the meta data about the call.
00793  * @param headerRow - the row in the ttm that has the meta data.
00794  *
00795  */
00796 /*****************************************************************************/
00797 CallResults GeneCall::translateExperimentCall(RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00798     const CallSet & completeSet,
00799     GenotypeTableModel & gtm,
00800     CallSet & chromatid1,
00801     CallSet & chromatid2,
00802     const std::string & dmet2CopyNumberCall,
00803     const CallSet & geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet)
00804 {
00805 
00806 
00807   bool isHaplotypeGroup
00808   = (chromatid1.getCallType() == ADT_CALL_TYPE_HAPLOTYPE_GROUP);
00809 
00810   unsigned int geneCopyNumber = 2;
00811 
00812   CallResults results(gtm.m_geneName, gtm.m_experimentName, chromatid1, chromatid2);
00813 
00814 
00815   // The callee passes in possibly invalid CallSets for the
00816   // 2 chromosomes derived from the
00817   // experiment records in the Genotype Short Report file.
00818   if (!  _translateExperimentCallCheck(rte, completeSet, gtm.m_geneName,
00819                                        gtm.m_experimentName, chromatid1,
00820                                        chromatid2, m_alleleSet)) {
00821     return results;
00822   }
00823 
00824   //DMET2 COPY NUMBER 0
00825   if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_dmet2Calling) {
00826     if (((rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputTTableType == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3) || isHaplotypeGroup) && !dmet2CopyNumberCall.empty()) {
00827       results.appendAlleleCall(dmet2CopyNumberCall, 0);
00828 
00829       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_CALL, gtm.m_geneName + ": " + gtm.m_experimentName + ": copy number call: " + dmet2CopyNumberCall);
00830       return results;
00831     }
00832   } else if (chromatid1.m_copyNumber == 0) {
00833     if (geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet.getCallType() != ADT_CALL_TYPE_NULL) {
00834       std::string alleleCall = geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet.m_name +  "/" +  geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet.m_name;
00835       results.appendAlleleCall(alleleCall, 0, geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet, geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet);
00836       return results;
00837     }
00838 
00839     else {
00840       geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet.describeVerbose(rte, ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL);
00841       APT_ERR_ABORT(gtm.m_experimentName + " " + gtm.m_geneName + ": copy number 0 values detected with no copy number 0 designation in the translation file.");
00842     }
00843   }
00844 
00845   geneCopyNumber = chromatid1.m_copyNumber;
00846 
00847   // THPS = HPPA * AHPS - (AHPS * ( AHPS-1) )/ 2;
00848   int                HPPA  = 1; // Haplotype Pairs per allele
00849   int                THPS  = 0; // Total Haplotype pairs seen
00850   std::map< std::string, int > AHPS;      // Allele haplotype pairs seen.
00851 
00852   int                THPR  = 0; // Total Haplotype pairs required.
00853   // THPR is a complex calculation broken out into another routine.
00854   THPR = _calculateTHPR(chromatid1, chromatid2, completeSet, HPPA);
00855 
00856   for (std::vector<CallSet>::const_iterator iCSit = m_alleleSet.begin();
00857        iCSit != m_alleleSet.end(); iCSit++) {
00858     AHPS[iCSit->m_name] = 0;
00859   }
00860 
00861 
00862   if (rte.m_currentVerbosity == ADT_VERBOSE_CALL) {
00863     std::stringstream msgSStr;
00864     msgSStr << "Total Haplotype Pairs Possible/Haplotype Pairs Per Allele: ";
00865     msgSStr << THPR << "/" << HPPA << endl;
00866     msgSStr << "chromatid1: " << (*chromatid1.m_ceSet.begin()).first << ", ";
00867     msgSStr << (*chromatid1.m_ceSet.begin()).second.basesToString() << endl;
00868     msgSStr << "chromatid2: " << (*chromatid2.m_ceSet.begin()).first << ", ";
00869     msgSStr << (*chromatid2.m_ceSet.begin()).second.basesToString() << endl;
00870     Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_CALL, msgSStr.str());
00871   }
00872 
00873   // The marker reference and variant sets are always the first two
00874   // sets, skip over them for haplotype groups;
00875   int offset = isHaplotypeGroup ? 2 : 0;
00876 
00877   for (std::vector<CallSet>::const_iterator iCSit = m_alleleSet.begin() + offset;
00878        iCSit != m_alleleSet.end() && (THPS < THPR);  ++iCSit) {
00879 
00880     // The following condition is possible if the allele name was
00881     // added as the second half of the call. If the number possible pairs
00882     // has already been seen for this allele then just optimize
00883     // by continuing.
00884     if (!(AHPS[iCSit->m_name] < HPPA))  continue;
00885 
00886     const CallSet & firstSet = *iCSit;
00887 
00888     Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_CALL, "First CallSet: " + firstSet.m_name, false);
00889 
00890     // Check if any combination of the two chromsomes match each
00891     // element. If so we have a match and the second match
00892     // will be a result of the remaining bases not used to make the first
00893     // match.
00894 
00895     if (! firstSet.match(chromatid1, chromatid2)) {
00896       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_CALL, " not found!");
00897       continue;
00898     }
00899 
00900     Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_CALL, " match!");
00901 
00902     // Build the second set from the difference between the
00903     // the test set and the inputs.
00904 
00905     CallSet secondSet = firstSet.buildSecondSet(rte, chromatid1, chromatid2);
00906 
00907     for (std::vector<CallSet>::const_iterator jCSit = iCSit;
00908          (jCSit != m_alleleSet.end()) && (results.size() < THPR) &&
00909          (AHPS[firstSet.m_name] < HPPA);   ++jCSit) {
00910 
00911       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_CALL, "Second CallSet: " + jCSit->m_name, false);
00912 
00913       if (secondSet == *jCSit) {
00914 
00915         if (jCSit->m_name != firstSet.m_name) {
00916           AHPS[jCSit->m_name]++;
00917         }
00918         AHPS[firstSet.m_name]++;
00919 
00920         std::string alleleCall = firstSet.m_name +  "/" +  jCSit->m_name;
00921         results.appendAlleleCall(alleleCall, geneCopyNumber, firstSet, *jCSit);
00922 
00923         Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_CALL, " match (" + alleleCall + ")!");
00924       } else {
00925         Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_CALL, " not found!");
00926       }
00927 
00928     } // for each allele in the translation table get a second match.
00929 
00930     if (AHPS[firstSet.m_name] < HPPA) {
00931       std::string alleleCall = firstSet.m_name + "/UNK" ;
00932       results.appendAlleleCall(alleleCall, geneCopyNumber, firstSet);
00933     }
00934     THPS += HPPA;
00935 
00936   } // For each allele in the translation table, check for a match.
00937 
00938   // If the number of allele pairs seen is less than the total required
00939   // then we add "UNK/UNK" to represent the difference.
00940   if (THPS < THPR) {
00941     results.appendAlleleCall("UNK/UNK", geneCopyNumber);
00942   }
00943 
00944   _translateExperimentCallCopyNumberOne(rte, results, chromatid1, geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet);
00945 
00946   results.orderCalls();
00947 
00948   return results;
00949 
00950 }
00951 // end GeneCall::translateExperimentCall
00952 /*****************************************************************************/
Generated on Wed Mar 23 2016 12:59:03 for Affymetrix Power Tools by  1.7.1
